COURSE NAME: AWS Cloud Practitioner

COURSE OVERVIEW: The AWS Cloud Practitioner course is designed to introduce participants to the fundamental concepts of AWS Cloud technologies. Participants will learn about the AWS Cloud's global infrastructure, architectural principles, and value proposition. The course will cover key services on the AWS platform, including their common use cases such as compute and analytics. Additionally, the course will address basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model.

COURSE SCHEDULE: 
- Start Date: 29.11.2024
- Duration: 10 sessions
- Academic Hours: 50
- Schedule: Tuesdays from 17:30 to 21:30 and Fridays from 09:00 to 13:00

LEARNING FORMAT: 
- The course is hybrid.
- Classes will be held at Bar-Ilan University campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, according to your preference.

COURSE TOPICS: 
- Define what the AWS Cloud is and the basic global infrastructure.
- Describe basic AWS Cloud architectural principles.
- Describe the AWS Cloud value proposition.
- Describe key services on the AWS platform and their common use cases, such as compute and analytics.
- Describe basic security and compliance aspects of the AWS platform and the shared security model.
- Define the billing, account management, and pricing models.
- Identify sources of documentation or technical assistance.
- Describe basic/core characteristics of deploying and operating in the AWS Cloud.

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION: 
- For admission interview and registration, contact Esther Asulin at 052-5886002 or esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION: 
- The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University.
